Name: Issue 266
Summary: This month there we have posts on Xamarin.Forms Shapes, UI Designs and Snippets to name just a few things.
Introduction: Wow, we are already half way through the year.  Where does the time go.  This month we have some great posts on the new Shapes feature, more WWDC reviews and great Xamarin.Forms posts.

Articles.Title: Virtual Events for Xamarin and .NET in July
Articles.Description: With life gone virtual, there are tons of new ways to take your development skills to the next level! Here are just a few of the amazing online events, streams, and videos to tune into this July.
Articles.Author: Jayme Singleton

Articles.Title: Skeuomorphic comeback?
Articles.Description: Will the new Apple Human Interface Guidelines bring back a resurgence in skeuomorphic design? I for one can't wait to get back my leather-bound notepad application icons.
Articles.Author: Michael Flarup

Articles.Title: Code Snippets for App Center Analytics
Articles.Description: If you use App Center then you'll appreciate these code snippets provided by Kirk.
Articles.Author: Patrick Junsay

Articles.Title: Simplifying Grids In Xamarin.Forms
Articles.Description: Grids have a delightful new syntax available in Xamarin.Forms 4.7 and it's also supported by everyones favorite Xamarin.Forms extension mFractor.
Articles.Author: Matthew Robbins

Articles.Title: WWDC 2020 Viewing Guide
Articles.Description: If you are looking for a summary of the best sessions to watch from WWDC2020, then look no further. Keith Harrison gives you his recommendations.
Articles.Author: Keith Harrison

Articles.Title: Tips and tricks working with Shapes
Articles.Description: Javier shares some tips and tricks with working with the new Shapes in Xamarin.Forms 4.7.  More specifically he provides some tools you can use to visually design shapes.
Articles.Author: Javier Suárez

Articles.Title: Xamarin.Forms UI Challenges - Pizza Shop
Articles.Description: Pizza is like the entire food pyramid. And this Xamarin UI Challenge, like our friend the pizza, has lots of delicious ingredients including animations, transitions, custom buttons, fonts and a sprinkle of SkiaSharp. Nom Nom.
Articles.Author: Kym Phillpotts

Articles.Title: Building a Rating Control using Xamarin.Forms Shapes
Articles.Description: In this blog post Daniel will show how you can use Xamarin.Forms and Shapes to create a rating control without using an external library.
Articles.Author: Daniel Hindrikes

Articles.Title: Create a Colorful Geometric Background using Xamarin.Forms Shapes
Articles.Description: Xamarin recently added new functionality for developers to build mobile apps: Xamarin.Forms Shapes. As the name suggest, it allows developers to create shapes without being restricted to rectangles or ellipses.
Articles.Author: Marco

Articles.Title: Xamarin Forms OTP verification
Articles.Description: OTP verification is a 2 Factor authentication which adds extra layer of security. Samir shares setting this up using Twillio and Xamarin.Forms.
Articles.Author: Samir G.C

Articles.Title: Two Cards Transition Control
Articles.Description: Charlin tackles creating a control that shows two elements (cards) stacked on top of each other and animate switching between them.
Articles.Author: Charlin Agramonte

Articles.Title: Base page concept using ContentView – Part 1
Articles.Description: Steven starts a blog series on bringing consistency to pages in your application by having a consistent base page.
Articles.Author: Steven Thewissen

Articles.Title: Code-Snippets for Visual Studio
Articles.Description: Sebastian shares some Xamarin code snippets for Visual Studio. *Note - Post is in German*
Articles.Author: Sebastian Jensen

Articles.Title: Playing Audio with the MediaManager Plugin
Articles.Description: You can play Audio in Xamarin.Forms across Android, iOS and Windows UWP using the super easy plug and play MediaManager Plugin.
Articles.Author: Udara Alwis

Articles.Title: Why Should You Choose Essential UI Kit
Articles.Description: Leomaris looks at Syncfusion Essential UI Kit a good introduction if you are looking at using Syncfusion controls in your project.

Articles.Title: MFractor for Windows | The Xamarin Show
Articles.Description: This week, James is joined by Matthew Robbins from the MFractor team who shows off the brand new version of MFractor with Windows support! MFractor adds several features so you can make great Xamarin and Xamarin.Forms apps faster.
Articles.Author: James Montemagno

Articles.Title: Merge Conflict 208: WWDC Detox + DTK Hype
Articles.Description: Frank lost his phone, James bought an iPhone, and WWDC is over!
Articles.Author: Merge Conflict

Articles.Title: DevTalk 40:  With Brandon Minnick
Articles.Description: On episode 40 of DevTalk Kerry speaks to Brandon Minnick about the road to publishing the developer productivity app GitTrends.
Articles.Author: Kerry Lothrop

Articles.Title: Xamarin.Forms Segmented Control with Sharpnado 1.7
Articles.Description: An updated version of the awesome Sharpnado controls is here with Segmented Controls and even moar shadows.
Articles.Author: Jean-Marie Alfonsi
